result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas S. Christman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas S. Christman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas S. Christman was found guilty of Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 75 days credit served,   Sentence consecutive to stayed WSP sentence in 15-CF-560.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription - as verified by agent.   Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment - Sex assault, Victimization.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
* Pay DNA surcharge.
 May Not have contact with known felons, drug users/dealers Shenanigan's.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Comply with Vitatrol Program - all requirements.

timeConds.notes: Stayed. Huber allowed at discreation of agent.
AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION. Huber for employment and treatment allowed.

Amended Report
From linked case 15-CF-560

of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Presentence incarceration credit.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes and stays a sentence of one year confinement w/credit for 75 days served, sentence consecutive to stayed WSP sentence in 15CF560; deft placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions concurrent to 15CF560; 1 year conditional jail stayed, w/Huber upon agent's discretion; no contact with known felons, drug users/dealers, Shenanigan's; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson requests to adjourn for reasons set forth on the record.  SEH adjourned to 4/28/16 at 10am.  Bond continued.
Letters of support for deft; filed by Atty K Watson.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 3/24/16 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Defendant Nicholas S. Christman appeared with Attorney Kristyne Alicen Watson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
